inclusion.criterion: Admission to the neurovascular service at UCSF (from the ED or from an outside hospital)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Diagnosis of acute stroke or intracerebral hemorrhage
inclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: An active medical problem requiring the use of a bladder catheter (e.g., congestive heart failure exacerbation, acute bladder outlet obstruction)
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients who are asymptomatic or have minimal symptoms from stroke
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Bladder catheter already in place for >12 hours
exclusion.label: met

notes: 62 yo male with hx of CVA, neurogenic bladder with indwelling suprapubic catheter with multiple prior admissions for UTIs, altered mental status, and urosepsis presents to the hospital in urosepsis now resolved after treatment with vanc/meropenem. Per CT there is a non-obstructing stone in the L ureter, no evidence of urethral strictures.
